ratings.comment: Amos Ron is an intriguing guy, but possibly the worst professor I've ever had. He rambles on about material unrelated to class about half the time. He has given almost zero examples for Theorems and Lemmas, and his phrasing for Quiz questions are incomprehensible even for native English speakers.

His lecture material on Canvas hasn't been updated since the 90's. Many students in class often confused about assignments, grading, and material. He had no syllabus, only rambles as announcements that discussed vague grading. Lecture's often become rambles and deviate from the online material. Would not recommend at all.

Amos Ron is a very intriguing guy. It is obvious that he is quite knowledgeable in many areas beyond the topics in this course. One of the most complex grading schemas i've ever had, but it's in favor of the students. He is really funny and nice to talk to. Lectures get quite difficult at a point, and the exams are hard but overall I learned a ton.

While the overall content is not that difficult, you will truly never know where you stand in the class. Amos's grading is very ambiguous and he curved to his liking which is somewhat stressful. He also is not the best at understanding specific questions so ask broadly about the topic and just hope he reaches is eventually.

Amos is definitely one of the most interesting professors I have met. He tells joke from time to time, most of them are really funny. The homework and quizzes are well designed so that they give you a comprehensive understanding of the materials lectured in class. Do make good use of them. He has heavy accent but bearable. Exams are hard.

Engaging and eccentric lecturer, gives a decent amount of homework. Biggest issue was communication. Canvas was not updated with correct grades for the whole semester, confusing grading policy, failure to respond to emails, and submitted grades 3 days past grading deadline. Good professor overall, but unnecessarily stressful.

I loved this class.  I took it only to learn Matlab for later use in image processing, but I ended up learning so much, particularly about eigenvalue methods.

My only criticism is that the grading of HWs by the TA was rather arbitrary and not timely.  He started off well, but I believe he got overwhelmed.

Amos is fun and eccentric, but has a heavy accent so prepare for that. You will learn a lot, but only if you really put in the time and effort. The homework is pretty difficult, and the class avg on the midterm was 50%. Definitely make friends in this class to study with. Lots of quizzes (1 during and 1 after every lecture). Hard class overall.

Attendance is mandatory, there will be a dumb quiz everyday in class for it. What he teaches in class are too hard to follow with little to no examples to explain the algorithms. Slides he uploads for references were helpful. If you have other options to learn linear algebra, just go for it instead of taking a class with this professor.

This class introduces some fun concepts, and Prof. Ron is a very engaging and eccentric professor. You can tell he cares about what he's teaching. The projects can be very tough and time-consuming but they are totally doable. You'll have to read the lecture notes pretty often. Grading criteria were kind of loosey-goosey. I had fun though!

Excellent lectures, Amos is funny and charismatic. He doesn't have the best organization when it comes to expectations in the class, so expect a lot of emails with critical information in them. HWs are long, and there is considerable work outside class, so you'll have to work for it.

Funny, caring( willing to arrange individual OH from 7 pm to 2 am which accommodated students from different time zone). It is not an easy class, you will need to put in the work. But it is not a difficult class either, there are many rooms for improvements.

Amos is great, but you need to be committed to get good grades. Hard homeworks and take a lot of time. Exams are not too bad. If you do the work, you will be fine. Believe me, you will learn a lot in this class.

Nice, funny, and also eccentric professor. IMO his lectures are hard to follow and require more time after class to review as compared to other professor's lectures. But if you actually put in the time to study after class, you'll do great. This class makes you a better mathematician.

Amos Ron is amazing. Great dry humor, knows material, sends hilarious emails frequently. I did find it easier to email TAs outside of class though. Also, do not miss class! And take decent notes. If you go, spend time reviewing, and try to be as perfect as possible on the homework, it's an easy A. Strong grasp of linear algebra basics recommended.
Don't take any of his course! Homeworks are really tough and always cost a lot of time but no help to exams. He likes to give nonsense in the class and delay when class should be end.

Amos Ron is an enigma. Sometimes his teaching is brilliant and creative, and sometimes its just hard to follow. He is eccentric, rude, charismatic, and stubborn at the same time. Lectures are 75 minutes 3 days/wk. Attending class is helpful. Exams are difficult. HW is assigned biweekly and takes many hours. Hard, but will make you smarter.

Amazing lectures! If you pay attention in class, it is easy to understand materials. Also, Professor Amos is hilarious and willing to help after class. Mock exam Exams are not easy, requiring a relatively deep understanding. Don't forget to set aside at least 10 hours for the biweekly HW. Take it seriously and you are guaranteed to learn a lot.

Attend every lecture is very helpful. He is very good at explaining. If you can understand everything in the lecture, exams will be easy. There're lecture notes on the website but no practice exam. Only six homework but each takes hours. By the way, he is humorous and energetic.
Good lectures, explains things well. Provides very additional material to work with, no practice exams, additional readings, etc.

An energetic lecturer who likes making jokes and engaging with the class. Doesn't give many opportunities for students to participate in the actual lecture, instead just powers through and gives answers where there could've been better opportunities for learning. Is really harsh on his attendance policy and is rather rude in emails.

This class was difficult, the homeworks were time consuming and the textbook offered little to no help. With that being said, I loved Professor Amos! He was funny, did a good job explaining difficult algorithms . There will be times where you curse him for having such long homeworks but at the end of it all Im a much better mathematician.

Professor Ron rocks. He knows exactly what he is talking about, and gives very accessible introduction to new concepts with examples. The key concepts were explained in an intuitive way, and attending every lecture of his will save you at least three hours of textbook reading. He is also hilarious as a person: his emails are extremely humorous.

While the only good professor for this class, Amos is far from a quality professor. He likes to ramble about nothing of importance ( 5 minutes of every class will be him rambling on how important it is he lectures to the very last minute). He explains things well, but if you don't understand, he will not explain. Homeworks are 10-15 pages biweekly

Fairly easy if you NEVER skip a single class and take EVERY homework seriously. Exams will not be like the exam but you will be fairly outstanding if you are outstanding from the beginning. As he always says: This is life, and you just get over it. I assume.
Best professor ever! His 412 is brilliant. Easy A for everyone
Best professor ever! Take his class! Easy A! Classes are structured in an easy-to-understand manner. Don't listen to those other comments as they aren't true.
Do not take this  class. He is horrible worst teacher.

I really enjoyed his lectures and would consider Professor Ron to be one of the best. The assignments require a bit of interpretation, however, the content of lectures and homework are coincident. Lectures are mandatory, and for good reason. The homework is thorough but will only take 4-6 hours, and are assigned biweekly which is plenty of time.

The assignments are far too long and unhelpful on the exam& the in class explanations are very abstract & CONVOLUTED. Rarely will he walk through an actual problem. The supplementary readings are fluffed,badly organized&written in unintelligible english sometimes. There's a large #of formulas which all differ slightly&you have to memorize them all.

I apologized to the TA for handing in a 70 page homework assignment. He said, "They're all that long." This was a very, very, very hard course. I felt I learned something fundamental, but the cost was enormously high.
worst teacher ever. super rude. homework is insanely long and he doens't give much explanation. outright called a student's question stupid and pointed at the board saying 'duh!' just don't.
If you take this class with this professor, the assignments will be much longer and much harder. This does not mean you will learn the material better

Professor Amos is the worse professor I have had in my academic career.  Compared to other sections of CS412, his assignments are way harder, and his grading scheme is way worse (one 40% midterm and one 40% final). His exams are not anything like the homework we spend 20 hours on and he makes us memorize equations.  He is also incredibly rude.

This professor loves to hear himself talk and will be immensely frusterating at times. Interrupts students before they can finish asking the question, or refuse to answer it at all. Homeworks are excessively long, tests are excessively difficult, and he does a poor job of getting points across during lecture. One of the worst professors I've had.

Terrible professor.  Homeworks are insanely long.  Tests are hard.  He is always sarcastic and mocks everyone to just make you feel worse about yourself.  Squeeks and does weird things in lecture which will freak you out.  Avoid at all costs!
If you like hard concepts taught poorly by a professor and then tested on variations of the concepts for your tests as well as 10 - 12 hours a week of homework then this is the class for you.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR!!!!! I am an electrical engineering student and was required to take CS 412.  He is horrible, the exams are hard as hell, he grades them poorly, and NO JOKE the homework assignments (there are only 6) WILL take you 20 hours per assignment.  HE SUCKS HE IS HARD THE CLASS IS BORING.
